author: Gary Armstrong
title: Furious Motherwell boss Mark McGhee turns on Aberdeen fans during 7-2 thrashing at Pittodrie
text:
Get football   
Motherwell boss Mark McGhee launched a tirade at Aberdeen fans as he suffered a nightmare return to his former club. 
His side slumped to a 7-2 defeat in one of his worst evenings in football, report the Daily Record . 
And things went from bad to worse for the ex-Dons boss as he was sent to the stand after arguing with the fourth official. 
As he went to take his seat in amongst the Aberdeen faithful he was greeted by ironic cheers and a Dons fan goading him by calling McGhee a 'f***ing clown', which the Motherwell boss didn't take too kindly to. McGhee had a nightmare return to his former side (Photo: PA) 
Speaking after the incident, McGhee said: "It was disgusting actually, I'm horrified the fourth official took the attitude he took." 
"I wasn't even getting excited about the fact we were losing the game. I wasn't losing my patience, I wasn't losing my temper. 
"I was having a bit of a laugh actually. 
"But right from the very first minute the fourth official seemed to me to have made up his mind, the attitude he was taking and to be honest he spoiled the game for me as much as the seven goals did.
